content: oh hey there welcome to the DMS craft I'm DM Scotty good to have you with me
again now this is going to be a short series about adding details to projects
these are things that may not be lengthy enough to do a whole video on but little
tips that will definitely add to your project add some interest to your tiles
and projects but not necessarily be enough to fill a full-length video so
this can be a series I'm going to do on short tips and let's go to our first one
here we go I have an irregular tile section I've made I show how to do this
in an earlier video I've already added some texture to the edge this is just a
basic tile now in my campaign my creatures of annoyance are mites and
they're very much like goblins they're just a buffet origin and they have an
affinity for living in hollows under trees and that type of thing so what I
pictured is that the mites use their powers to shape roots and everything so
they can live in these caves and unlike stuff and then like regular
caves I don't make these out of show these like stone I mean these are like
dirt with with roots that hold up the the cave so it doesn't collapse so I've
come up with an ingenious way to add the roots to a tile and I'm just going to
use my trusty glue gun and then just put it on the tile and then just kind of do
a squiggly line hope you can see this and another one coming out from it and
just keep adding and then and just add as many as you want and
this will show up great once you do the tile I'm going to come in for a closer
look so you can see exactly what I'm doing so here we are observed in quite a
bit I've got an empty section here so I'm going to start doing the root system
so I'll just do a squiggly line taper off and add another one to it and then
just keep adding until I'm satisfied and then you want to do it on the other side
so I hope you can see this since the glue is clear it's a little hard but
you'll see it much better we're going to paint this and you'll see it much better
now what I'm going to do is I'm going to paint this with a texture paint okay
there I've got all my roots in I'm going to paint this with the texture paint but
I'm going to use the brown texture paint to give it a dirt texture as opposed to
the stone texture so I'll go ahead and paint that and then we'll move to the
next step so here we go I've got my tile I've got
my dirt texture on there so what I'm gonna do now is I'm going to water down
my black and I'm going to do some edging shadow around the edge kind of gives it
a more three-dimensional quality and this is fairly wet and it may look a
little dark now but it'll it'll dry thinner
there we go that gives it some dimension also what I'm going to do is I'm going
to use the black to trace around my root system so I'll just kind of doesn't have
to be perfect you just you don't want it too thick this will help you have the
roots a three-dimensional quality when I dry brush that's when the magic really
happens okay so there we go we will let this dry and then we'll move on to the
dry brush and we'll be finished with this time
so here's our tile it's all dry so now what we're going to do is use the
the light tan it's actually a coffee color and it's just a library light tan
so I'll get that on the brush no water I'm just using it directly so now I'll
just pick out the edge see how that pops out now it looks a little lighter than
it will when it dries so a lot of paints do so that kind of picks out the edge
there now what I'm going to do is kind of go over the surface of these vines
and see how this really pop out well the roots actually see how those roots
really pop out you can also get a little bit on the
title itself so there we go ready-made routes and so look how good
that looks now one last little thing I'm going to
do is I'm going to add a little bit of green to this just to add some variation
to the color on the tile so we'll put that on now so I'll just use a little
bit of classical green and I'll get that on my brush and I'm just going to hit a
little bit on the roots not too much just add some different
so there we go we've got our tile all set and ready for adventure and join us
